about_the_game:
Features:

  • Meta-game mode: Discover a new mode that tries to connect the video game with real situations...

  • Parodic story: you are in the system house, prey to the imperative to be productive and profitable every moment of your life. However, your tired body prevents you from continuing to work, so the junjuma has come to consider you as a "poor bad guy" who should be persecuted and blamed. Will you be able to run away from the guilt?

  • Solve logical and accessible puzzles: Escape the system house by showing your wits and solving logical puzzles through an accessible interface.

  • Cartoon style graphics: enjoy a unique use of the color palette.

Story:


Year X. The apocalyptic end seems to be approaching and power has been miniaturized, since it no longer needs large disciplinary spaces, but only a network of small algorithmic machines known as junjumas. In each of the house systems that are distributed in the different regions of the world, a junjuma controls the computation of economic, social and biological flows, imposing the objectives to be achieved, using other machines to subject human beings to the imperatives of guilt and productivity. The junjumas connect with each other into a terrifying and systematic monster known as the Tragala, and nothing seems possible. Will you, Kurt, escape the house system to try and find a different mode of existence?

  • Cartoon style graphics: enjoy a unique use of the color palette.

name: Tragala

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: Intel i5
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGLR compatible
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

short_description: Tragala is a graphic adventure game in which you will play Kurt, a restless young man who tries to escape from the system house ruled by the junjuma, a control and blame machine that is part of a systematic and terrible monster known as Tragala.
supported_languages:
English*, French*, Spanish - Spain*
*languages with full audio support
